verses.kjv: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!
verses.web: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”
verses.ct: As Jesus was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, "Teacher, look at these incredible stones and magnificent buildings!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "You see all these great buildings? Not a single stone will be left standing on another. Every one of them will be torn down."

verses.kjv: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.web: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.ct: Later, Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives, looking across at the temple. Peter, James, John, and Andrew came to him privately and asked,

verses.kjv: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?
verses.web: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”
verses.ct: "Tell us, when will this happen? And what will be the sign that all of this is about to take place?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any man deceive you:
verses.web: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
verses.ct: Jesus began to tell them, "Be on your guard so that no one deceives you.

verses.kjv: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.
verses.web: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and will lead many astray.
verses.ct: Many will come using my name, claiming, 'I am the Christ,' and they will deceive many people.

verses.kjv: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for such things must needs be; but the end shall not be yet.
verses.web: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.ct: When you hear about wars and rumors of wars, don't be alarmed. These things have to happen, but it won't be the end yet.

verses.kjv: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
verses.web: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.ct: Nations will go to war against each other, and kingdoms will clash. There will be earthquakes in many places, along with famines and upheaval. But all of this is just the beginning — like the first pains of childbirth.

verses.kjv: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.
verses.web: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.
verses.ct: Watch out for yourselves. You'll be handed over to local courts and beaten in synagogues. You'll stand trial before governors and kings because of me, and your testimony will be a witness to them.

verses.kjv: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.
verses.web: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
verses.ct: But before the end comes, the gospel must be proclaimed to every nation.

verses.kjv: But when they shall lead you, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.
verses.web: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.ct: When they arrest you and put you on trial, don't worry ahead of time about what to say. Don't rehearse your words. Just speak whatever is given to you in that moment, because it won't be you speaking — it will be the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against their parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.
verses.web: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.
verses.ct: Brothers will hand over their own brothers to be killed. Fathers will betray their children. Children will turn against their parents and have them put to death.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
verses.web: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.ct: Everyone will hate you because you follow me. But whoever stands firm to the end will be saved.

verses.kjv: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:
verses.web: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not” (let the reader understand), “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,
verses.ct: When you see the abomination of desolation — the thing Daniel the prophet spoke about — standing where it should never be (let the reader understand what this means), then everyone in Judea must flee to the mountains.

verses.kjv: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter therein, to take any thing out of his house:
verses.web: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.
verses.ct: If you're on the roof of your house, don't go back inside to grab anything.

verses.kjv: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.
verses.web: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
verses.ct: If you're out in the field, don't go back to get your cloak.

verses.kjv: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!
verses.web: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for pregnant women and nursing mothers in those days!

verses.kjv: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.
verses.web: Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.
verses.ct: Pray that your escape doesn't happen in winter.

verses.kjv: For in those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.
verses.web: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.
verses.ct: Because the suffering in those days will be worse than anything the world has seen from the moment God created it until now — and nothing like it will ever happen again.

verses.kjv: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect’s sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.
verses.web: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.
verses.ct: If the Lord hadn't cut those days short, no one on earth would survive. But for the sake of his chosen people, he has shortened them.

verses.kjv: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here is Christ; or, lo, he is there; believe him not:
verses.web: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.
verses.ct: If anyone tells you at that time, 'Look, here is the Christ!' or 'He's over there!' — don't believe it.

verses.kjv: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect.
verses.web: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.
verses.ct: False christs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive — if it were possible — even God's chosen people.

verses.kjv: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.
verses.web: But you watch. “Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.
verses.ct: So stay alert. I've warned you about all of this ahead of time.

verses.kjv: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,
verses.web: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,
verses.ct: In those days, after that time of suffering, the sun will go dark and the moon will stop shining.

verses.kjv: And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.
verses.web: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.ct: Stars will fall from the sky, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.

verses.kjv: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
verses.web: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
verses.ct: Then everyone will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

verses.kjv: And then shall he send his angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.
verses.web: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.
verses.ct: He will send out his angels to gather his chosen people from every direction — from the farthest corners of the earth to the farthest reaches of the sky.

verses.kjv: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near:
verses.web: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near;
verses.ct: "Learn this lesson from the fig tree: when its branches turn tender and its leaves begin to sprout, you know summer is close.

verses.kjv: So ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh, even at the doors.
verses.web: even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.
verses.ct: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you'll know the time is near — right at the door.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.
verses.web: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: this generation will not pass away before all these things take place.

verses.kjv: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
verses.web: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
verses.ct: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.kjv: But of that day and that hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels which are in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.
verses.web: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.ct: No one knows the day or the hour when this will happen — not the angels in heaven, not even the Son — only the Father.

verses.kjv: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.
verses.web: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.
verses.ct: Stay alert, keep watch, and pray, because you don't know when the time will come.

verses.kjv: For the Son of man is as a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.
verses.web: “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.
verses.ct: It's like a man who goes on a long journey. Before leaving, he puts his servants in charge, assigns each one a task, and tells the doorkeeper to stay alert.

verses.kjv: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:
verses.web: Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;
verses.ct: So stay watchful, because you don't know when the master of the house will return — whether in the evening, at midnight, at the rooster's crow, or at dawn.

verses.kjv: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.
verses.web: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.
verses.ct: Don't let him arrive suddenly and find you asleep.

verses.kjv: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.
verses.web: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”
verses.ct: What I'm telling you, I'm telling everyone: Stay watchful!"
